intro: Colysis pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leafed colysis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, typically consisting of five leaflets, and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
